title: Flooding Chaos in Yellowstone, a Sign of Crises to Come
abstract: Record rainfall and mudslides forced closures just as tourism season ramped up. Virtually none of America’s national parks are untouched by extreme weather and climate change.
byline: By Jim Robbins, Thomas Fuller and Christine Chung

multimedia.caption: The Yellowstone River flooding parts of Paradise Valley, a northern corridor to Yellowstone National Park.

title: A Decade After DACA, the Rise of a New Generation of Undocumented Students
abstract: A vast majority of undocumented teenagers are graduating high school this year without protection from deportation and the ability to legally work.
des_facet: Dream Act (Development, Relief and Education for Minors Act)

multimedia.caption: Tommy Esquivel said goodbye to his science teacher, Alycia Escobedo, at Hollywood High School in Los Angeles. He has had to pass up career-building opportunities because of his undocumented status.

abstract: Flooding and mudslides from recent storms have collapsed bridges and washed away roads in the national park.

title: Southern Baptists Elect New Leader Amid Deepening Divisions
abstract: The nation’s largest Protestant denomination, a bellwether for conservative Christianity, chose a rural Texas pastor and approved actions to address its sex abuse crisis.

title: Alaska Kills 4 Bears That Entered Homeless Camp
abstract: The bears had been rummaging through tents at a park managed by the city of Anchorage. No one was injured, according to a city spokesman.

title: What the BA.5 Subvariant Could Mean for the United States
abstract: The most transmissible variant yet of the coronavirus is threatening a fresh wave of infections in the United States, even among those who have recovered from the virus fairly recently.

title: The Strident Writings of a Young Blake Masters Dog His Senate Run
abstract: As a Stanford student in 2007, the Arizona candidate, now 35, chose a CrossFit chat room to express his opposition to U.S. involvement in World War II and downplay Al Qaeda as a threat to Americans.

title: Witnesses in Young Thug Case Have Been Threatened, Prosecutors Say
abstract: Following a May indictment accusing the rapper and 27 others of gang-related crimes, defense lawyers must now withhold witnesses’ contact information from their clients.

title: Explosion Destroys Mysterious Monument in Georgia, Authorities Say
abstract: For more than four decades, the Georgia Guidestones near Elberton Ga., have been an enigma. On Wednesday, the authorities said, “unknown individuals” destroyed a large part of the structure.

abstract: Meteorologists recorded winds of up to 99 miles per hour in parts of the state, with minor damage reported.
